Pre-Game Insights: Scotland will have their work cut out for them in Group B, alongside two previous T20 World Cup champions in Australia and England, Namibia and Oman, the other teams in the group, will also provide stiff competition.
If Scotland are to make it to the Super Eight stage, they have to defeat the two desert nations Namibia and Oman and hope for an England slip up against them.
A win against the ruthless and hard-nosed Aussies might be a step too far.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland has been in imperious form, averaging over 40 and striking at 150, since the last T20 World Cup in 2022.
Scotland won 9 out of their last 12 completed T20Is, including a 2-1 away series win against UAE and a clean sweep of the European qualifier.
Others: Scotland has selected a largely unchanged XV with only four players missing out from the last World Cup.
Their path through the regional qualifiers was a comfortable one; sweeping aside Ireland, Italy, Jersey, Germany, Denmark and Austria to finish top of the group.
